result.execSummary:
The defendant Laura L. Berry was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Possession of THC, an unclassified misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 961.41(3g)(e).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

miscConds.notes:
Cash bond of $500 applied to fine and court costs.

Defendant shall pay supervision fees as ordered by the Department of Corrections. 

If probation is ordered and ultimately revoked or discharged with outstanding financial obligations, a civil judgment shall be entered against the defendant in favor of restitution victims and/or governmental entities for the balance due.  All available enforcement actions will be used.
Participate in counseling as deemed appropriate by the agent.
Undergo an AODA assessment and follow through with recommended treatment.

timeConds.notes:
Conditional jail shall commence no later than 06-23-2014 at 4:30 pm.

The defendant shall pay all sheriff and jail fees or costs allowed or imposed by law and the sheriff shall be entitled to a judgment against the defendant for any such unpaid fees or costs.

Jail can be served in any county in the State of Wisconsin provided arrangements are made by counsel or the defendant, it is approved by the Taylor County Jail, and at no additional cost to Taylor County.

judgments.action: Guilty Due to No Contest Plea

charges.dispoDesc: Guilty Due to No Contest Plea

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Laura L. Berry

records.descr: Records of prosec. are converted data. See file.
Notice of court ordered financial obligations

records.addlTxt: DOC Face Sheet Intake and Investigation

Defendant Laura L. Berry in court with attorney Karl J Kelz.  Kristi S Tlusty appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Agreement placed on the record by Ms. Tlusty.  State moved to amend charge to a misdemeanor possession of THC - granted.  Plea of no contest entered.  Plea colloquy.  Court found plea given freely, voluntarily, and intelligently; accepted plea; found DE guilty and ordered entry of JOC.  No further comments by parties.  Court withheld sentence and placed DE on probation for one year with the following conditions:  $100 fine with court costs; DNA surcharge; 5 days county jail with Huber to start NLT 06-23-2014 at 4:30 pm; counseling as deemed appropriate by agent; undergo AODA and follow through with recommended treatment plan.  11 days sentence credit determined.
Motion hearing on May 23, 2014 at 08:30 am.
Order for Appearance at Settlement Conference; Report to Court on Results of Settlement Conference.

Defendant Laura L. Berry in court with attorney Karl J Kelz.  Kristi S. Tlusty appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Waived further reading of complaint; requested a preliminary hearing with time limits waived.  PTC set.  Bond continued.  Pre-trial conference scheduled for March 14, 2014 at 09:30 am.

Cover Letter from Attorney Kelz - Receive 1-16-14
Cover Letter to Sheriff's Department with Unsigned Bond - Dated 12/16/2013
Request for Bond Modifcation from Defendant

Kristi Tlusty appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Defendant appeared in court in custody. Court found probable cause for the arrest. Court advised DE of possible charges and penalties. Court advised DE of right to attorney.  Notice of right to attorney given to defendant.  State requested a $2,000 cash bond with conditions of: comply with booking and no possession or consumption of controlled substances.  Response by defendant. Court ordered a $500.00 cash bond with conditions as requested.  Initial appearance set for 01-21-2014 at 1:30 p.m.
